pr_title: NPE extended message returns fully qualified names

timeline.message:
NPE extended message returns fully qualified names

Added convertToJavaFullyQualifiedName(vmThread, fullyQualifiedNameUTF)
to replace '/' with '.';
Added convertMethodSignature(vmThread, methodSig) to convert a signature
string from an example
([[[Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/Void;BLjava/lang/String;ICDFJLjava/lang/Object;SZ)Ljava/lang/String;
to (java.lang.String[][][], java.lang.Void, byte, java.lang.String, int,
char, double, float, long, java.lang.Object, short, boolean)
Added tests;
Minor refactoring.

Signed-off-by: Jason Feng <fengj@ca.ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText:
The contract for this method is:
* Assuming the method signature is well formed.

so you don't need both the ) and the length check.  Same for the while loop below
timeline.author: DanHeidinga
DanHeidinga
DanHeidinga
DanHeidinga

timeline.bodyText: can you avoid the additional strlen?
timeline.author: DanHeidinga

replies.bodyText: Not sure about the additional strlen reference. During earlier buffer size calculation, the elementType length was hardcoded without strlen.
replies.author: JasonFengJ9

timeline.bodyText: Can arity be defined here in the loop?  And a new variable introduced in the other variable?  Neither lives past the end of the loop so better to encapsulate them in their own loops
timeline.author: DanHeidinga

replies.bodyText: Yeah, moved the variable definition into the their own loops.
replies.author: JasonFengJ9

timeline.bodyText: what if one of these allocations fails?
timeline.author: DanHeidinga

replies.bodyText:
Good catch, j9str_printf represents a NULL value with string literal NULL, the thought was to still have some info when one of them fails, such as NULL.method() or java.lang.String.NULL. However it will be NULL.NULL when both fail. Looked it again, the messages with NULL seem odd as well.
Maybe just no extended message at all if either of allocation returns NULL?
replies.author: JasonFengJ9

replies.bodyText:
Maybe just no extended message at all if either of allocation returns NULL?

Makes sense to me.  Any failure should result in no extended message (and maybe a tracepoint to help debug why)
replies.author: DanHeidinga

replies.bodyText:
Agreed.
Regarding the tracepoint, existing Trc_VM_ConvertToJavaFullyQualifiedName_Get_ClassName(vmThread, result, length, fullyQualifiedNameUTF); can record the returned value of convertToJavaFullyQualifiedName(), and Trc_VM_ConvertMethodSignature_Signature_Result(vmThread, result, bufferSize); records  the returned value of convertMethodSignature().
replies.author: JasonFengJ9

timeline.bodyText: dist_functional  should not be removed. This target is defined in the upper level. And it is used when the BUILD_LIST is specifically set to subdir.
timeline.author: llxia
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -61,7 +61,7 @@
 		</javac>
 	</target>
 
-	<target name="dist" depends="compile,dist_functional" description="generate the distribution" >
+	<target name="dist" depends="compile" description="generate the distribution" >

replies.bodyText: Aha, I was fooled by Eclipse error message that target dist_functional doesn't exist in this project. Put it back now.
replies.author: JasonFengJ9

timeline.author: gacholio

replies.bodyText:
The NULL check was skipped because j9str_printf accepts NULL and a NULL message will be returned instead of attempting to create another different error message (other than current NPE).
There is a comment for earlier j9mem_allocate_memory call https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/blob/01c213f220a1e86c2977a23becf7cf7206bbe7a3/runtime/vm/extendedMessageNPE.cpp#L85
replies.author: JasonFengJ9

timeline.author: gacholio

replies.bodyText: Similar scenario like the case above.
replies.author: JasonFengJ9
